Description: Shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figure pottery closed vessel, possibly an oinochoe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of hoplite to right (head and helmet with added red on crest, shield with red, and left hand holding porpax remaining); at right of sherd perhaps part of spear.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 56, no. A18, pl. XLIV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.065) (Phase 1)
